snippet: A leader of the State Senate, Jeffrey Klein, is adopting a new strategy to try to build support for a languishing bill to install speed-tracking cameras: limiting cameras to some school zones where speeding is a problem.
abstract: New York State Sen Jeffrey Klein is attempting to rebuild support for languishing bill, which would install speed-tracking cameras in New York City, by proposing that the cameras be limited to school zones where speeding is a problem.
lead_paragraph: A leader of the State Senate, Jeffrey Klein, is adopting a new strategy to try to build support for a languishing bill to install speed-tracking cameras: limiting cameras to some school zones where speeding is a problem.

headline.main: Push for Speed Cameras Turns to School Zones
headline.print_headline: Push for Speed Cameras Turns to School Zones
